name: embl_ebi_mcp
description: Unified MCP server exposing EMBL-EBI Search, Summary (S4), and UniProt Protein APIs, including global and domain search, entry retrieval, cross-references, biological summaries, protein identity, features, proteomics, proteomes, taxonomy, coordinates, UniParc, and accession annotations.

tools.name: search_all
tools.description: Search across all EMBL-EBI indexed domains.

tools.name: search_domain
tools.description: Search within a specific EMBL-EBI domain (e.g. UniProt, Ensembl, Literature).

tools.name: search_get_entry
tools.description: Retrieve full metadata for one or more entries from a domain.

tools.name: search_xref_targeted
tools.description: Retrieve cross-references from a source entry to a specific target domain.

tools.name: search_xref_all
tools.description: Retrieve all cross-references for a given entry across all linked domains.

tools.name: search_xref_domain
tools.description: Discover which domains are cross-referenced by a given source domain.

tools.name: search_more_like_this_same_domain
tools.description: Find biologically similar entries within the same domain.

tools.name: search_more_like_this_cross_domain
tools.description: Find biologically related entries in a different target domain.

tools.name: search_summary_suggestions
tools.description: Get suggested biological summary terms using the EBI Summary (S4) API.

tools.name: search_summary_identification
tools.description: Resolve and identify mixed or ambiguous biological identifiers.

tools.name: search_summary_multireference
tools.description: Summarize biological entities across multiple references.

tools.name: search_summary_details
tools.description: Retrieve detailed biological summaries for a given entity.

tools.name: protein_identity
tools.description: Retrieve UniProt protein identity and core metadata by accession.

tools.name: protein_features
tools.description: Retrieve curated UniProt protein features such as domains, regions, and sites.

tools.name: protein_proteomics
tools.description: Retrieve peptide-level proteomics evidence including PTM, non-PTM, and HPP data.

tools.name: protein_proteomes
tools.description: Retrieve proteome-level metadata and organism coverage from UniProt.

tools.name: protein_taxonomy
tools.description: Retrieve taxonomy information associated with UniProt protein entries.

tools.name: protein_coordinates
tools.description: Retrieve genomic coordinate mappings for UniProt protein accessions.

tools.name: protein_uniparc
tools.description: Access UniParc non-redundant protein sequence archive and sequence identity mappings.

tools.name: protein_accession_annotations
tools.description: Retrieve accession-level annotations linked to UniProt protein records.

tools.name: pdbe_beacons
tools.description: Retrieve PDB structural coverage, chains, and residue-level annotations for UniProt proteins using the PDBe 3D-Beacons API. Accepts UniProt accessions or UniProt entry names, with optional residue ranges.

tools.name: pdbe_complex
tools.description: Retrieve macromolecular complex information from PDBe, including symmetry, participants, assemblies, interactions, bound molecules, PISA parameters, and complex identifier history. Accepts PDB IDs, PDB Complex IDs, Complex Portal IDs, or UniProt/Rfam accessions depending on the selected action.

tools.name: pdbe_variantRelated
tools.description: Retrieve residue-level structural, ligand, interaction, and annotation context for protein variants using the PDBe PepVEP API. Accepts UniProt accessions with one or more amino-acid positions as input.

tools.name: pdbe_topology
tools.description: Retrieve 2D secondary structure topology for protein chains from PDBe, including helices, strands, coils, termini, and layout coordinates derived from PDBsum. Accepts a PDB entry ID with an optional chain ID as input.

tools.name: pdbe_rfamMappings
tools.description: Retrieve nucleic acid mappings between PDB structures and Rfam or related sequence domain resources. Accepts either a PDB ID or an Rfam accession and returns residue-level chain mappings with safe, summarized output.

tools.name: pdbe_pisa
tools.description: Retrieve detailed macromolecular interface information from PDBe PISA, including interface area, energetics, interacting residues, bonds, and participating molecules. Requires PDB ID, assembly ID, and interface ID as input.

tools.name: pdbe_compounds
tools.description: Retrieve chemical compound information from PDBe, including similarity relationships, structural subcomponents, physicochemical summaries, interaction statistics, and UniProt protein associations. Accepts PDB ligand hetcodes as input.

tools.name: pdbe_uniprot
tools.description: Access PDBe-KB UniProt-centric data including structures, domains, ligands, interactions, complexes, conservation, variation, and LLM annotations. Supports summarized, size-limited outputs suitable for LLM tool usage.

tools.name: pdbe_validation
tools.description: Access PDBe wwPDB validation data including geometry outliers, Ramachandran and sidechain quality, clashes, refinement statistics, global percentiles, residue-wise outliers, and NMR validation results. Supports GET and POST endpoints with size-limited, normalized outputs suitable for LLM tool usage.

tools.name: pdbe_sifts
tools.description: Access PDBe SIFTS mappings and topology data, including PDB â†” UniProt isoforms, Ensembl, Pfam, InterPro, CATH, SCOP, GO, EC, UniRef90, Homologene clusters, best structures, UniProt publications, and 2D topology layouts. All endpoints are normalized, size-limited, and safely handled for heterogeneous or empty biological responses.
